page.title: 04Dairy Farming
page.content: West Town House is a dairy farm run by the same family for almost 100 years. They have a pedigree herd of 185 cows, 25 in calf at present. They rear their own calves in a separate unit. There is one bull with the herd. Each cow gives approximately 500 litres of milk per year. All the milk is used to make cheese. Each cow's personal development is monitored by the computer for winter feeding and health purposes. As the farm is on the edge of the Somerset levels the land has been extensively drained to make it suitable for dairy pasture. There are 14 paddocks of about 4 acres each which are used in rotation for 3 feeds and then fertilised. Beyond the paddocks are several silage fields.
